str2: And, even, also, namely.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Himself, herself, itself.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
Truly, really, certainly, surely. Adverb from alethes; truly.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and apostello; to send away forth, i.e. to despatch, or to dismiss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and haireomai; actively, to tear out; middle voice, to select; figuratively, to release.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.
A hand.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
Expectation, waiting. From prosdokao; apprehension; by implication, infliction anticipated.
